alert.note: Alert for Marion; Sequatchie (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 02 at 4:47PM CDT until June 02 at 9:15PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT/8 PM CDT/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Bradley, Hamilton, Marion and Sequatchie. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT /800 PM CDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 547 PM EDT /447 PM CDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in portions of the advisory area. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Chattanooga, Cleveland, Jasper, Soddy-Daisy, Signal Mountain, South Pittsburg, Walden, Lakesite, Whitwell, Kimball, Monteagle, Ridgeside, Fairmount, Harrison, South Cleveland, East Cleveland, Wildwood Lake, Red Bank, Collegedale and Powells Crossroads. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
